intro: Diacrium bigibberosum, commonly known as the two-gibbered diacrium, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its distinctive floral structure. It belongs to the family Diacriaceae and is native to a specific region in South America. The plant features showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers with a complex arrangement of petals and stamens. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
